summary: SummaryBaBylissPRO Nano Titaniumâ„¢ StyleSwitchâ„¢ just might be the lightest and smallest ionic multi-styler handle.
details: DetailsFeaturesErgonomically designed to fit comfortably in your handIncludes 5 unique attachments for a variety of styling needsSmoothing attachment achieves sleek, polished hair with Babyliss's root-reaching design; smooths hair roots to tipsAdjustable drying attachment lets you choose the airflow that's right for you; unique design offers 3 options of concentrated airflow for tailored drying & styling1 3/4" Round brush is perfect for creating smooth, soft waves and full blowouts; long nylon bristles gently detangle while short natural bristles style and add shineDiffuser has extra-deep bowl to accomodate all curl types and hair lengths; waved-perimeter design follows the contours of your head for optimal stylingAutomatic dual voltage for seamless worldwide useLimited 2-Year warrantyItem 2640006How To UseSee package for usage detailsCaution: See package for normal warnings related to high heat and electrical appliances
how_to_use: See package for usage detailsCaution: See package for normal warnings related to high heat and electrical appliances

reviews.headline: I Love it
reviews.comments: I 100% recommend it, it's super nice and works great !!!

reviews.headline: Better than Dry bar one shot!
reviews.comments: Absolutely love this blow dryer! Has different heat settings and fan speeds. I really love that it has a pause button. The boar bristles grab all of my hair with ease and makes my hair super soft, shiny and doesn't make my hair frizz.

reviews.headline: Not worth the money
reviews.comments: The product is ok dont get me wrong. It gets the job done but ira NOT worth the price!

reviews.headline: better than shark
reviews.comments: I tried shark and returned it, too loud seemed to work ok.i got this and it's awesome feels stronger than shark and sleeker. I also had dyson airwrap and sold it to my sister. this is not as cumbersome as the dyson tho the dyson has those curl attachments but you can get the same thing with the brush on this tbh. I am a professional hair stylist for the record.

reviews.headline: Recommend for my 4A/4B sisters
reviews.comments: I love this blow dryer, I always struggled with blowing out my hair by myself. The paddle brush helps me blow out and detangle my hair at the same time! I don't have to worry about the attachment coming off because this one has a lock.

reviews.headline: Exactly as described
reviews.comments: This tool does it all except curl! I used two other drying brushes (one under $50 and another over $100) but this is the only one that leaves me with frizz free hair.

reviews.headline: maybe user fault
reviews.comments: Every time i go to use it on hot, it turns off and blinks repeatedly til i switch it off. But also turns off when i have it on cool. Not sure if i got a defected one or i'm at fault and using it incorrectly?

reviews.headline: Get a Hairdryer!
reviews.comments: A hair dryer and my fingers do the same thing this system does. I will still have to use a straightener or curling iron or just let my hair air dry if I want my natural curls. I wanted a system that if I used it, my hair would be good to go. Especially for the price. I also thought it would help my hair with heat damage.  Maybe I don't know what I'm doing with it, but I am disappointed.

reviews.headline: Love It! =)
reviews.comments: My purchase, not a paid review. Sold my more expensive unit for this & I'm so relieved. This is actually an upgrade & makes blow-drying my hair more engaging. The quality & functionality, exceptional! I look forward to using this product on wash days. It helps simplify the process while still offering options to switch it up.

reviews.headline: Absolutely love it.
reviews.comments:
Real customer here. Not paid for this review. 

This is probably one of the best hair styling tools I've purchased in a very long time. Its easy to use and doesnt sound like a power tool when it's on. My favorite attachment right now is the paddle brush. I can use it after showering and my hair gets dry fairly fast. For reference I have a little longer than shoulder length hair and its on the thicker side. With the amount of hair I have I struggled to find something powerful enough, but not so damaging, to dry my hair fairly quickly. With this, not only is it quick, but it ends up looking nicely styled and I'm usually ready to head out the door when I'm done. Such a plus for me as a mom. I can get ready in the short amounts of time I usually have in the mornings before work haha. Definitely worth the money for me.

reviews.headline: Close but not good enough for price
reviews.comments:
I bought this multi styler with my own money and tried it out a few times. I liked a lot of things about it, but its missing some key features that make it not work the price for me so i will be returning it. 

Pros:
Very light weight, smaller than other multistylers, and also comes with an awesome lightweight soft case, so it would be great for traveling! 
Love that it has multiple attachments and heat/flow settings so you dont need as many tools. The lowest heat setting is pretty cool which is great for hair health 
Round brush is a great attachment
The concentrator/dryer is powerful and dries hair quickly
I LOVE that the diffuser is large, ANGLED, and has prongs

Cons:
The smoother attachment is horrible if you want to use the plates becuase they only open up a little bit so you have to section your hair into small sections and shove it in. Its like a flat iron that only opens half an inch. 
I have wavy/curly hair so i dont need a paddle brush attacment 
Does NOT come with a curling or a straightening attachment and they dont have extra attachments that can be purchased separately
And lastly, this isnt a huge deal but I wish the difuser had prongs that could be extended like the shark has, because it would really help with drying my roots/gently targeting different sections of thick hair 

Overall i love the concept (especially size and weight) and some of the attachemnts. I would repruchase this if they came out with more attachments that could be added on. Unfortauntely as of now it is missing some key features that would make this item worth it for me.

reviews.headline: Beccajmc46
reviews.comments: I wanted to love this product so much, but it did mot work for me. I gave it two stars because I would  recommend it for anyone who isn't losing hair.

reviews.headline: NOT WORTH IT!
reviews.comments: This product is already making misleading claims saying it's the "lightest and smallest on the market" when the Drybar one is much lighter and smaller than this - the comparison is only to Dyson and Shark. I tried this in hopes of that being true, but to me, it felt heavy and bulky. I had the Shark, returned it bc it was so long. I have the Dyson, kept bc it works, but no metal plates for styling except the round brush, so I figured I'd give this one a try. The Dyson is a longer, slimmer design so the weight is distributed nicely. This Babyliss dryer is shorter and stocky, which makes it heavier on the wrist when styling. I will say it comes with a diffuser, so +1 for the curly girls, but not worth it to me even though I have cuy hair. But the ultimate styling tool to me is the Drybar interchangable styler - doesn't make wild claims AND has a curling iron. The Babyliss isn't worth the money and I am returning it.

reviews.headline: SO WORTH IT
reviews.comments: If you are debating between getting the shark dryer and this one, GET THIS ONE. I purchased the shark one and returned it because it got so hot even on the lowest setting, gave me a crazy amount of frizz, and it was just crazy heavy. I purchased this ine after i returned the shark one and the difference between the two is crazy. This one is lightweight and small but has A TON of power. Doesnt get too hot, but gets hot enough that you can still style it. I have zero frizz and my hair actually feels soft when i finish styling it instead of dry and frizzy. Plus, this dryer is more affordable and comes with the travel bag. The only "complaint" is that the smoothing tool doesnt open very much so it can be a little hard to get your hair in, but it really isnt a big deal at all

reviews.headline: Nice but too large
reviews.comments: While I liked the dryer features the brush attachment is too large for my chin length hair

reviews.headline: BL
reviews.comments: My hair is super curly and I work very well on it, i lived

media.headline: Dry and style in one go

faceoff_positive.comments:
I've got kind of a pageboy/mushroom type haircut and lately styling it with a regular hairdryer and round brush is just not doing it for me, just leaving the top of my hair too flat. I tried some cheaper round and oval brush dryers from conair/revlon and found they were very hot and left my hair with a lot of flyaways and frizz. So when I was gifted this multi styler to try for my honest opinion, I was a bit skeptical but really looking forward to trying something new in hopes that it would work better for me. It's really has been a gamechanger. 

My first impression was the case it comes in is very nice, I have cats that love destroying power cords, so having a nice quilted zip up case to store it in is a great bonus. The handle part has a good weight to it, it definitely feels higher quality than what I had before. the cord swivels easily and never gets tangled when using and the attachments are very easy to swap. 

My favorite attachment by far is the round brush. It's got boar bristles and regular, it really does smooth my hair in a way no other has, leaves it the perfect shape I want. I don't even need a flat iron anymore. The paddle brush is nice too. I tried using the straightener attachment but my hair is a little short for it, think it would be ideal for long hair that's a little thinner than mine to get it in the slot. The diffuser isn't really of use to me either. 

What sets it apart is really the separate temperature and fan speed settings, I think a lower fan speed also keeps my hair from blowing out of the brush and becoming flyaways. Even the hottest setting never feels too hot, the brush has never been too hot to touch. 

Overall this is a fantastic tool and worth spending a little extra on after trying so many cheap alternatives and being disappointed. My hair is bouncy and happy now.
faceoff_positive.headline: Pulled Me Out of a Styling Slump

faceoff_negative.comments: This product is already making misleading claims saying it's the "lightest and smallest on the market" when the Drybar one is much lighter and smaller than this - the comparison is only to Dyson and Shark.
